channel.title: Statements :: IT From Scratch
channel.description: The global Statement If you need to modify a global variable from within a function, use the global statement. Including a line such as global eggs at the top of a function tells Python, “In this function, eggs refers to the global variable, so don’t create a local variable with this name. Input def spam(): global eggs eggs = 'spam' eggs = 'global' spam() print(eggs) Output
